owner_contact.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete is prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for construction applications including residential and commercial foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, and public works infrastructure.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects with high-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation exceeding 0.1% by weight.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on National Waste Report 2022

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete through carbonation is not included in this EPD but recognized as a natural process reducing net CO2 emissions over lifetime.

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.note: These stages are deemed not applicable for Holcim's ready-mix concrete ranges and are not included in this EPD.

references: British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V5.0 and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects.
